notes_display: Analysis by A.A. Gordus, University of Michigan 1974, by Neutron activation of streak
issue_obverse_figure_s: Right Profile of Shapur II on frontal bust
issue_obverse_figure_description_s: crown with three floral elements; covered korymbos; pearl diadem, diadem ribbons commencing above ball of hair, pointing to the left, earing consisting of two elements; neck-line of tunica edged with row of pearls; double row of pearls running the shoulders to the breast ornament (the latter not visible); dotted border
issue_obverse_legend_s: 11 h l. o.šhpwhly MRKAn [WRHA]|Šābuhr šāhān [?]|"shapur, king of [?]” Incomplete and pseudo-legend
issue_reverse_figure_description_s: base consisting of two elements; square altar shaft; to the left and right of the shaft ribbons pointing downwards, connected across the shaft; four altar plates; above altar flames depicted by vertical lines; to the left of flames symbol (SNS 3, var.25), to the right symbol (SNS 3, var. 33); to the left and the right of the altar attendant with stylized mural crown, holding a barsom in both hands, both attendants with korymbos, both facing inwards; both attendants with korymbos, dotted border
issue_reverse_legend_s: 4 h l. o. [NWR]A ZY  ; 9h l. o. šh[pwhly]|ādur ī Šābuhr|“the fire of Shapur”; symbol to the left of altar flames (SNS 3, var.33), symbol to the right of altar flame ( var.25)
